Is Cache expensive?

Cache, OK
StateOklahoma
Population2,842

In comparison to its nearby areas, Cache is a bit more expensive, and it is a lot less expensive compared to the entire nation. However it is a bit less expensive compared to the city of Oklahoma City.

Home prices

The value of the median home in Cache is $133,100. It is roughly $8,240 (6%) higher compared to its nearby areas.Compared to the country as a whole it is about $84,400 (38%) lower, and in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City is approximately $25,400 (16%) lower.

Rents

Cache's median monthly rent is $725. In comparison to the surrounding areas this is roughly $133 (15%) lower.It is approximately $337 (31%) lower in comparison to the US as a whole, and is about $146 (16%) lower compared to the city of Oklahoma City.

Nearby places

Medicine Park

Medicine Park is approximately 9 miles northeast from Cache. The real estate prices there are significantly more expensive. The median home price in Medicine Park is $226,200, which works out to $93,100 (41%) higher than Cache. Rent there is somewhat more expensive. In Medicine Park the median rent is $975 a month, which comes out to $250 (25%) higher than Cache.

Lawton

Lawton is roughly 9 miles east of Cache. The housing prices there are somewhat less expensive. The cost of the median home in Lawton is $112,800, which is $20,300 (17%) lower than Cache. Rent there is a little more expensive. The median monthly rent in Lawton is $832, which is $107 (12%) higher than Cache.

Faxon

Faxon is about 12 miles south from Cache. Its housing prices are fairly similar. The cost of the median home in Faxon is $131,300, which is $1,800 (1%) lower than Cache. Its rents are a bit less expensive. In Faxon the median rent is $663 a month, which works out to $62 (9%) lower than Cache.

Chattanooga

Chattanooga is roughly 15 miles south from Cache. The real estate prices there are significantly less expensive. The cost of the median home in Chattanooga is $78,100, which comes out to $55,000 (70%) lower than Cache. The rent there is a bit more expensive. In Chattanooga the median monthly rent is $1,054, which comes out to $329 (31%) higher than Cache.

Geronimo

Geronimo is roughly 15 miles southeast of Cache. The real estate prices there are significantly less expensive. Geronimo's median home value is $75,900, which comes out to $57,200 (75%) lower than Cache. Rent there is a bit more expensive. The median monthly rent in Geronimo is $764, which works out to $39 (5%) higher than Cache.
